required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of SilverHawk®/TurboHawk® in Lower Extremity Vessels (DEFINITIVE™ LE)
clinical_study.official_title: Determination of Effectiveness of SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision (SilverHawk Device) for the Treatment of Infrainguinal Vessels/Lower Extremities

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the intermediate and long-term effectiveness of stand-alone atherectomy treatment of peripheral arterial disease in the legs.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Patency Rate (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint analysis for claudication subjects was primary patency rate at one year, defined by duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ratio ≤ 3.5 at the target lesion(s) with no clinically-driven reintervention within the treated segment in subjects who had claudication (RCC of 1 - 3) at time of enrollment.

primary_outcome.measure: Amputation-Free Survival at 1 Year (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia RCC 4-6)
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint for CLI was amputation-free survival at one year, defined as freedom from a major, unplanned amputation of the target limb through the 1-year visit in subjects who have CLI (RCC 4 - 6) at time of enrollment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following use of the SilverHawk device
secondary_outcome.description: Device success was defined as ≤ 30% residual stenosis following use of the SilverHawk device, as measured by angiography, without adjunctive endovascular interventions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following use of the SilverHawk and adjunctive devices
secondary_outcome.description: Procedure success was defined as ≤ 30% residual stenosis following use of SilverHawk device and adjunctive endovascular interventions (if required) as measured by angiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Major Adverse Event Rate (in All Patients Enrolled)
secondary_outcome.description: Major Adverse Event Rate (MAE) at 30 Days was defined as clinically-driven target vessel revascularization (TVR), major unplanned amputation of treated limb, or all-cause mortality within 30 days post procedure, as classified by the Clinical Events Committee (CEC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Major Adverse Event Rate (in All Patients Enrolled)
secondary_outcome.description: Major Adverse Event Rate at One Year was defined as clinically-driven target vessel revascularization, major unplanned amputation of the treated limb, or all-cause mortality within one year, as classified by the Clinical Events Committee (CEC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Walking Impairment Questionnaire Score (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
secondary_outcome.description: WIQ Walking Distance Scores at Baseline and One Year are presented for subjects who have claudication. The Walking Improvement Questionnaire (WIQ) is a validated method to assess objective improvement in functional walking ability of subjects with intermittent claudication. Difficulty walking a distance was self-assessed at baseline by the patient (prior to treatment) and at the one year follow up visit. Scale ranges from 0 (minimum) to 100 (maximum), with larger numbers representing better outcomes. An increase in WIQ scores at 1 year represents an improvement over baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rutherford Clinical Category (in All Patients Enrolled)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in RCC at One Year was assessed and percentage of subjects with an improvement in clinical status indicated by a decrease of one or more in RCC at one year compared to baseline, that is attributable to the treated limb (in cases of bilateral disease), was calculated.

Change in Ankle-Brachial Index at One Year was calculated and percentage of subjects with an increase (improvement) in the ankle-brachial index (ABI) at one year compared to baseline in subjects with compressible arteries and baseline ABI < 0.9 was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Patency (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary patency was defined as measured by duplex ultrasound peak systolic velocity ratio ≤ 3.5 maintained by repeat percutaneous intervention in subjects who have claudication; estimated as freedom from loss of patency by the Kaplan-Meier method at one year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Primary Patency (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia RCC 4-6)
secondary_outcome.description: The primary patency for CLI was defined by duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ratio ≤ 3.5 at the target lesion(s) with no clinically-driven reintervention within the treated segment in subjects who have CLI at time of enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Amputation-Free Survival (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
secondary_outcome.description: Amputation-Free Survival in Claudicants at One Year was defined as freedom from a major, unplanned amputation of the target limb through the one year visit in subjects who have claudication at time of enrollment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Wound Healing (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia and With Wounds RCC 5-6)
secondary_outcome.description: Wound healing at three months was defined as a decrease of at least one Wagner Classification grade of the wound at three months compared to baseline in subjects who have Rutherford Clinical Category score of 5 or 6 at the time of enrollment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Alternative Patency Rate (Peak Systolic Velocity ≤ 2.4) at 1 Year (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
secondary_outcome.description: Defined by the duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ration ≤ 2.4 at the target lesion (s) with no clinically-driven re- intervention with the treated segment in subjects who have claudication at time of enrollment.

arm_group.description: All patients enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy.

intervention.description: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Has a Rutherford Clinical Category Score of 1 - 6.
- Has evidence of ≥ 50% stenosis or occlusion in the superficial femoral, popliteal, anterior tibial, posterior tibial and/or peroneal arteries, confirmed by angiography.
- Has identifiable distal target vessel which upon completion of the intervention, is anticipated to provide re-constitution of blood flow to the foot.
- Exchangeable guidewire must cross lesion(s), with ability of catheter to cross lesion.
- Each discrete target lesion's length is ≤ 20 cm.
- Reference vessel diameter is ≥ 1.5 mm and ≤ 7 mm.
Exclusion Criteria
- Has surgical or endovascular procedure of the target vessel within 14 days prior to the index procedure.
- Has any planned surgical intervention or endovascular procedure within 30 days after the index procedure.
- Has had a previous peripheral bypass affecting the target limb.
- Has end-stage renal disease defined as undergoing hemodialysis for kidney failure.
- Has presence of severe calcification in target lesion(s).
- Has in-stent restenosis of the target lesion.
- Has an aneurysmal target vessel.
- Has significant stenosis or occlusion of inflow tract that has not been revascularized prior to treatment of the target vessel.
- Has perforation, dissection or other injury of the access or target vessel requiring additional stenting or surgical intervention prior to enrollment.
- Has disease that precludes safe advancement of the SilverHawk/TurboHawk device to the target lesion(s).
- Has had a previous amputation above the metatarsal line on the target limb.
- Has end-stage renal disease defined as undergoing hemodialysis for kidney failure.

overall_official.affiliation: St. Elizabeth's Medical Center, Tuft's University School of Medicine

reference.citation: McKinsey JF, Zeller T, Rocha-Singh KJ, Jaff MR, Garcia LA; DEFINITIVE LE Investigators. Lower extremity revascularization using directional atherectomy: 12-month prospective results of the DEFINITIVE LE study. JACC Cardiovasc Interv. 2014 Aug;7(8):923-33. doi: 10.1016/j.jcin.2014.05.006.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects with all severities of peripheral arterial disease were recruited for this single-arm study. Outcome measures may apply to all subjects or be specific to level of disease severity (ie subjects w/claudication RCC1-3, subjects w/critical limb ischemia RCC4 (no wounds) or RCC5-6 (with wounds)). These are specified in the Arm/Group titles.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 800 subjects were enrolled. One subject was excluded from all data analyses due to an invalid informed consent and was not considered started.

group.title: Atherectomy
group.description: All patients enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

baseline.population: 800 patients were enrolled, but 1 subject’s data were excluded from all analyses due to an invalid informed consent, yielding a cohort of 799 analyzable subjects.

group.title: Atherectomy
group.description: All patients enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

outcome.title: Primary Patency Rate (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
outcome.description: The primary endpoint analysis for claudication subjects was primary patency rate at one year, defined by duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ratio ≤ 3.5 at the target lesion(s) with no clinically-driven reintervention within the treated segment in subjects who had claudication (RCC of 1 – 3) at time of enrollment.
outcome.population: Kaplan-Meier estimate of the freedom from loss of primary patency in lesions (N=743 lesions)

group.title: Claudicant Subgroup
group.description: Subjects who had claudication (RCC of 1 – 3) at time of enrollment.

measure.title: Primary Patency Rate (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
measure.description: The primary endpoint analysis for claudication subjects was primary patency rate at one year, defined by duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ratio ≤ 3.5 at the target lesion(s) with no clinically-driven reintervention within the treated segment in subjects who had claudication (RCC of 1 – 3) at time of enrollment.
measure.population: Kaplan-Meier estimate of the freedom from loss of primary patency in lesions (N=743 lesions)

outcome.title: Amputation-Free Survival at 1 Year (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia RCC 4-6)
outcome.description: The primary endpoint for CLI was amputation-free survival at one year, defined as freedom from a major, unplanned amputation of the target limb through the 1-year visit in subjects who have CLI (RCC 4 – 6) at time of enrollment.

group.title: CLI Subgroup
group.description: Subjects who had CLI (RCC 4 – 6) at time of enrollment

measure.title: Amputation-Free Survival at 1 Year (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia RCC 4-6)
measure.description: The primary endpoint for CLI was amputation-free survival at one year, defined as freedom from a major, unplanned amputation of the target limb through the 1-year visit in subjects who have CLI (RCC 4 – 6) at time of enrollment.

outcome.title: Device Success (in All Patients Enrolled)
outcome.description: Device success was defined as ≤ 30% residual stenosis following use of the SilverHawk device, as measured by angiography, without adjunctive endovascular interventions.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately following use of the SilverHawk device
outcome.population: Lesions with core angiographic laboratory measurements of residual stenosis

group.title: All Patients
group.description: All patients enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

measure.title: Device Success (in All Patients Enrolled)
measure.description: Device success was defined as ≤ 30% residual stenosis following use of the SilverHawk device, as measured by angiography, without adjunctive endovascular interventions.
measure.population: Lesions with core angiographic laboratory measurements of residual stenosis

outcome.title: Procedural Success (in All Patients Enrolled)
outcome.description: Procedure success was defined as ≤ 30% residual stenosis following use of SilverHawk device and adjunctive endovascular interventions (if required) as measured by angiography
outcome.time_frame: Immediately following use of the SilverHawk and adjunctive devices
outcome.population: All lesions with angiographic core lab assessment of residual stenosis at the end of the procedure were included

group.title: All Patients
group.description: All patients enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

measure.description: Procedure success was defined as ≤ 30% residual stenosis following use of SilverHawk device and adjunctive endovascular interventions (if required) as measured by angiography
measure.population: All lesions with angiographic core lab assessment of residual stenosis at the end of the procedure were included

outcome.title: Walking Impairment Questionnaire Score (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
outcome.description: WIQ Walking Distance Scores at Baseline and One Year are presented for subjects who have claudication. The Walking Improvement Questionnaire (WIQ) is a validated method to assess objective improvement in functional walking ability of subjects with intermittent claudication. Difficulty walking a distance was self-assessed at baseline by the patient (prior to treatment) and at the one year follow up visit. Scale ranges from 0 (minimum) to 100 (maximum), with larger numbers representing better outcomes. An increase in WIQ scores at 1 year represents an improvement over baseline.
outcome.population: All subjects treated for claudication RCC 1-3 with completed WIQ forms

group.title: Claudicant Subgroup (Baseline)
group.description: All claudicant subjects enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy and had walking distance measured prior to treatment. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

group.title: Claudicant Subgroup (One Year)
group.description: All claudicant subjects (RCC 1-3) enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy and walking distance measured at the one year follow-up visit. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

measure.title: Walking Impairment Questionnaire Score (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
measure.description: WIQ Walking Distance Scores at Baseline and One Year are presented for subjects who have claudication. The Walking Improvement Questionnaire (WIQ) is a validated method to assess objective improvement in functional walking ability of subjects with intermittent claudication. Difficulty walking a distance was self-assessed at baseline by the patient (prior to treatment) and at the one year follow up visit. Scale ranges from 0 (minimum) to 100 (maximum), with larger numbers representing better outcomes. An increase in WIQ scores at 1 year represents an improvement over baseline.
measure.population: All subjects treated for claudication RCC 1-3 with completed WIQ forms

outcome.title: Rutherford Clinical Category (in All Patients Enrolled)
outcome.description: Change in RCC at One Year was assessed and percentage of subjects with an improvement in clinical status indicated by a decrease of one or more in RCC at one year compared to baseline, that is attributable to the treated limb (in cases of bilateral disease), was calculated.
outcome.population: All patients with RCC data at baseline and 1 year

group.title: All Patients
group.description: All patients enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

outcome.description: Change in Ankle-Brachial Index at One Year was calculated and percentage of subjects with an increase (improvement) in the ankle-brachial index (ABI) at one year compared to baseline in subjects with compressible arteries and baseline ABI < 0.9 was calculated.
outcome.population: All patients with compressible arteries and a baseline ABI < 0.9.

group.description: All patients enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

measure.population: All patients with compressible arteries and a baseline ABI < 0.9.

outcome.description: Secondary patency was defined as measured by duplex ultrasound peak systolic velocity ratio ≤ 3.5 maintained by repeat percutaneous intervention in subjects who have claudication; estimated as freedom from loss of patency by the Kaplan-Meier method at one year.

group.description: Subjects who had claudication (RCC of 1 – 3) at time of enrollment.

outcome.title: Primary Patency (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia RCC 4-6)
outcome.description: The primary patency for CLI was defined by duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ratio ≤ 3.5 at the target lesion(s) with no clinically-driven reintervention within the treated segment in subjects who have CLI at time of enrollment

group.title: CLI Subgroup
group.description: Subjects who had CLI (RCC 4 – 6) at time of enrollment

measure.title: Primary Patency (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia RCC 4-6)
measure.description: The primary patency for CLI was defined by duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ratio ≤ 3.5 at the target lesion(s) with no clinically-driven reintervention within the treated segment in subjects who have CLI at time of enrollment

outcome.title: Amputation-Free Survival (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
outcome.description: Amputation-Free Survival in Claudicants at One Year was defined as freedom from a major, unplanned amputation of the target limb through the one year visit in subjects who have claudication at time of enrollment.

group.title: Claudicant Subjects
group.description: Subjects who had claudication (RCC of 1 – 3) at time of enrollment.

measure.title: Amputation-Free Survival (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
measure.description: Amputation-Free Survival in Claudicants at One Year was defined as freedom from a major, unplanned amputation of the target limb through the one year visit in subjects who have claudication at time of enrollment.

outcome.title: Wound Healing (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia and With Wounds RCC 5-6)
outcome.description: Wound healing at three months was defined as a decrease of at least one Wagner Classification grade of the wound at three months compared to baseline in subjects who have Rutherford Clinical Category score of 5 or 6 at the time of enrollment.
outcome.population: Patients with wounds at baseline who had wound assessment scores at baseline and at 3 months.

group.title: CLI Subgroup
group.description: Wound healing was assessed in subjects who had Rutherford Clinical Category score of 5 or 6 at the time of enrollment.

measure.title: Wound Healing (in Patients Treated for Critical Limb Ischemia and With Wounds RCC 5-6)
measure.description: Wound healing at three months was defined as a decrease of at least one Wagner Classification grade of the wound at three months compared to baseline in subjects who have Rutherford Clinical Category score of 5 or 6 at the time of enrollment.
measure.population: Patients with wounds at baseline who had wound assessment scores at baseline and at 3 months.

outcome.title: Alternative Patency Rate (Peak Systolic Velocity ≤ 2.4) at 1 Year (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
outcome.description: Defined by the duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ration ≤ 2.4 at the target lesion (s) with no clinically-driven re- intervention with the treated segment in subjects who have claudication at time of enrollment.
outcome.population: Lesions in patients with claudication at baseline

group.title: Claudicant Subgroup
group.description: Subjects who had claudication (RCC of 1 – 3) at time of enrollment.

measure.title: Alternative Patency Rate (Peak Systolic Velocity ≤ 2.4) at 1 Year (in Patients Treated for Claudication RCC 1-3)
measure.description: Defined by the duplex ultrasound measurement of peak systolic velocity ration ≤ 2.4 at the target lesion (s) with no clinically-driven re- intervention with the treated segment in subjects who have claudication at time of enrollment.
measure.population: Lesions in patients with claudication at baseline

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected throughout the 12 month follow-up of the study.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were reviewed and classified by a third party clinical events committee. AEs were classified as device-related and/or procedure-related, as well as Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and Major Adverse Events (MAEs).

group.title: All Patients
group.description: All patients enrolled in this single-arm study were treated with directional atherectomy. SilverHawk Peripheral Plaque Excision System: Removal of atherosclerotic plaque from artery walls.

event.description: Other” included events such as acute coronary syndrome, back pain, fractures, cancers, non-target lesions revascularizations, heart failure, pneumonia, etc.

event.sub_title: Pseudoaneurysm not at the access site

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study’s principal limitations include a lack of randomization and follow-up beyond 12 months.
